passage_text: While your competition’s delivery fees may impact the amount you charge for your business’s delivery services, aim to cover expenses – and, ideally turn a profit for providing services to a customer – by assessing delivery fees for your administrative efforts and labor costs.

A New York Times reporter investigating diet delivery services said Chef’s Diet cost him nearly $400 for the first week. Calories range from 1,300 to 1,500 per day, although the company claims to focus more on portion sizes and food groupings.

The delivery surcharge could be a percentage of the total dollar of the order or a flat rate. Make it clear that if the customer orders from more than one restaurant at one time, there will be a surcharge for each of the restaurants and the delivery time will increase.

Phil Dumontet started Dashed, a Boston-based food-delivery service, with nothing more than two wheels and a plastic food container. Today, the 26-year-old CEO has rolled out his service to five cities and more than 500 restaurants, including chains such as P.F. Chang's and Pinkberry.

1) DELICIOUS FOOD, featuring the finest local food delivery restaurants, rated by our customers on taste, quantity & presentation. 2) AMAZING SERVICE, with easy online ordering and an expert team of local food delivery specialists to make sure you look good on every order.

In a addition to the delivery charge, a gratuity of 15% of your food total is included on all orders with a minimum gratuity of $3.00. Excess tipping is appreciated but not expected. Please remember our drivers not only invest their time, but their gasoline to make sure your experience with us is a pleasurable one.

Choose from a variety of local restaurants by entering your location and time of delivery. Browse by restaurant and menu items, or filter by cuisine type, price point, and catering options. Once your delivery order is placed, we connect the order to the restaurant and a local independent driver.

Combine the vehicle costs and labor charges for each class to determine the delivery fee necessary for each class of stock to be delivered. Compare these delivery charges to your competitors’ fees, and make sure you don’t price yourself out of the market.

How much does the service cost? The delivery charge ranges from $3.99 to $6.99. The delivery charge is based on the size of your order and/or the restaurant you choose. Look to the left of each menu under hours of operation to see each restaurant's terms (on average the delivery charge is $3.99).

Divide this charge by the average number of deliveries your company makes in a year to determine a base vehicle operating cost per delivery. Because this figure represents only routine deliveries, charge additional fees for long-distance deliveries or those outside your normal service area.
